DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study Acupuncture Prevention Primary Dysmenorrhea
DOC.detailed_description: This multicenter , single blind , randomize control , three-arm , large-scale clinical trial . We recruit 300 PD woman meet diagnostic criterion PD establish 2005 Canada gynaecology obstetrics association . Exclusion criterion include illiteracy , breast feeding woman , pregnancy woman , serious systemic disease , mental patient , acupuncture experience . Eligible woman randomly assign verum acupuncture group , sham acupuncture group usual care group . Participants verum acupuncture group receive traditional acupuncture treatment treat ture needle , While Participants sham acupuncture group treat sham acupuncture non-insertive needle non-acupuncture point . Acupuncture treatment start 5th 7th day estimate first day menstrual cycle , cycle , participant receive one session treatment day 5 consecutive day ( treatment course ) , totally 15 session 3 treatment course . Participants usual care group receive treatment besides health education control group . This trail compose one-menstrual cycle baseline , three-menstrual cycle treatment ( cycle 1 3 ) , three-menstrual cycle follow-up period ( cycle 4-6 ) . The primary outcome measure change Cox Menstrual Symptom Scale ( CMSS ) menstrual cycle compare baseline . Secondary outcome measure include Visual Analogue Scale ( VAS ) , McGill pain questionnaire ( SF-MPQ ) , Pittsburgh sleep quality index ( PSQI ) , intake acute medication . Psychological outcome measure Beck Depression Rating Scale ( BDI ) , Beck Anxiety Inventory ( BAI ) , NEO Five-Factor Inventory ( NEO-FFI ) , Doctor-Patient Relationship Scale ( PDRQ ) , Difficult Doctor-Patient Relationship Questionnaire ( DDPRQ ) , Expectations intervention assess acupuncture expectancy scale ( AES ) . Deqi sensation measure MGH Acupuncture Sensation Scale ( MASS ) .
